summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing the copying and transfer of a 12 TB drive containing evidence. It involves coordination between the New York Field Office and possibly the Southern District, with one agent mentioning a personal trip to Denver due to a family emergency.

persons.name: M, I.
persons.role: NY CART Coordinator, Senior Forensic Examiner
persons.context: FBI agent in New York coordinating the copying of a 12 TB drive, mentions traveling to Denver due to a family emergency.

events.title: 12 TB drive copy completion and pickup
events.description: An FBI agent confirms the copy of a 12 TB drive is finished and ready for pickup at the New York Field Office.

events.title: Agent's sister in hospice
events.description: An FBI agent mentions needing to travel to Denver because their sister is in hospice, prompting urgency in copying evidence.

keyFacts: FBI personnel are handling a 12 TB drive containing evidence, indicating a large volume of data in the investigation.
The email chain shows coordination between the New York Field Office and possibly the Southern District (referred to as 'Southern') for evidence processing.
One agent's personal emergency (sister in hospice) is cited as a reason for urgency in copying the evidence.
The document is subject to a protective order restricting certain paragraphs.
The correspondence is dated July 2020, post-Jeffrey Epstein's death, suggesting ongoing investigative work.
